Class AveragingFilterN

  • java.lang.Object
    • Filter<T>
      • FilterN<java.lang.Double>
        • AveragingFilterN
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GenericFilter<java.lang.Double>

    public class AveragingFilterN
extends FilterN<java.lang.Double>
    AveragingFilterN extends FilterN, enforcing a double input and keeping track of the number of inputs there has been. However, once the size reaches n, the calculation for the average changes, subtracting the oldest input an adding the newest: average = average - (last / N) + (input / N);
    Author:
    gmh73

      • AveragingFilterN

        public AveragingFilterN(int n)
        Makes an Averaging Filter that only remembers N elements
        Parameters:
        n - The number of elements the filter will remember

    • Method Detail

      • processInput

        protected void processInput(java.lang.Double input)
        Recalculates the average with the given input. If there has been N inputs, the oldest will be forgotten and subtracted from the average.
        Specified by:
        processInput in class Filter<java.lang.Double>
        Parameters:
        input - the current input

      • reset

        public void reset(java.lang.Double r)
        Resets the average to r and fills our memory with r. So, for a filter with N = 3, reset(2.0) would fill the memory with (2.0, 2.0, 2.0) and the average is 2.0. However, the previous output will be remembered (until a new input is given)
        Overrides:
        reset in class FilterN<java.lang.Double>
